title: How to avoid altitude sickness in the medieval age - Quora

response.answer_text: Just like they do today. You acclimate to your elevation. If you were to live at sea level and in a blink of an eye you were whisked away up onto Pikes Peak out in the Rocky Mountains, you would immediately notice that the air is thinner. If you were with a group playing frisbee, you'd notice how winded you were. If you were to throw a backpack on and then try to climb a local peak, you'd likely be taking more rest breaks. In a couple of weeks you'd hardly notice it, unless you were pushing yourself.
There would have been no understanding of altitude sickness in the medieval period, so avoidance wouldn’t have been considered.
